intro: Chuquiraga juniperina, commonly known as the Andean juniper, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit, with small, clustered flowers and narrow, leathery leaves. It thrives in high-altitude environments, often growing in rocky or alpine soils. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens in cooler climates.
